name: Goblet Squat
setup: Hold bell at chest (horns for KB or one end of DB), forearms vertical
Brace lightly and keep ribs stacked over pelvis
steps: Inhale, sit hips back slightly and bend knees to descend
Track knees over mid-foot; keep torso tall and elbows pointing down
Pause briefly near parallel (or to comfortable depth)
Exhale, drive through mid-foot/heels to stand tall
Finish with glutes squeezed softly, ribs down
cues: Elbows down; bell tight to chest
Sit between the ankles, not onto the toes
Own the bottom, then drive up
mistakes: Heels lifting or weight shifting to toes
Cutting depth too high without intent
safety: If knees or low back get cranky, reduce depth, elevate heels on plates, or squat to a box. Keep spine neutral and bell close to chest.

regressions: Box goblet squat (set box to pain-free depth)
Heels-elevated goblet squat (small plates or wedge)
Counterbalance squat holding a light plate at arms-length
progressions: Tempo goblet (3-2-1) or 2s pause at bottom
Cyclist goblet squat (narrow stance, heels elevated)

prescriptionHints.load: KB 12–24 kg or DB 25–60 lb depending on reps and experience
prescriptionHints.notes: Start conservative; aim to leave 2–3 reps in reserve. Use box/heels as needed.

joints.notes: Maintain mid-foot balance; keep knees tracking over toes and spine neutral.
